2:
"Permit me to speak a little longer, and I will show you some things
\q because I have a little more to say in defense of God.
\q
3:
I will obtain my knowledge from far off;
\q I will acknowledge that righteousness belongs to my Maker.
5:
See, God is mighty, and despises no one;
\q he is mighty in strength of understanding.
6:
He does not preserve the life of wicked people
\q but instead does what is right for those who suffer.
\q
7:
He does not withdraw his eyes from righteous people
\q but instead sets them on thrones like kings forever,
\q and they are lifted up.
8:
If they are bound in chains
\q and trapped in cords of suffering,
\q
9:
then he reveals to them what they have done,
\q and their transgressions and their pride.
10:
He also opens their ears to his instruction,
\q and commands them to turn back from iniquity.
\q
11:
If they listen to him and worship him,
\q they will spend their days in prosperity,
\q their years in contentment.
\q
12:
However, if they do not listen, they will perish by the sword;
\q they will die because they have no knowledge.
14:
They die in their youth;
\q their lives end among the cultic prostitutes.
16:
Indeed, he would like to draw you out of distress
\q into a broad place where there is no hardship
\q and where your table would be set with food full of fatness.
18:
Do not let your anger entice you to mockery,
\q or the greatness of a ransom to turn you aside.
19:
Can your wealth benefit you, so that you will not be in distress,
\q or can all the force of your strength help you?
\q
20:
Do not desire the night, to commit sin against others,
\q when peoples are cut off in their place.
\q
21:
Be careful that you do not turn to sin
\q because you are being tested by suffering so that you will stay away from sinning.
23:
Who has ever instructed him about his way?
\q Who can ever say to him, 'You have committed unrighteousness?'
\q
24:
Remember to praise his deeds,
\q of which people have sung.
25:
All people have looked on those deeds,
\q but they see those deeds only from far away.
\q
26:
See, God is great, but we do not understand him well;
\q the number of his years is incalculable.
27:
For he draws up the drops of water
\q that he distills as rain from his vapor,
\f + \ft Some modern versions have \fqa that distill as rain from his vapor \fqb . \f*
\q
28:
which the clouds pour down
\q and drop in abundance on mankind.
\q
29:
Indeed, can anyone understand the extensive spread of the clouds
\q and the thunder from his hut?
30:
See, he spreads his lightning around him
\q and covers the roots of the sea.
\q
31:
In this way he judges the peoples
\q and gives food in abundance.
32:
He fills his hands with the lightning
\q until he commands it to strike its mark.
\q
33:
Its thunder warns of the storm,
\q the cattle can also hear it is coming.
